Dear Wizards- Because You Reprinted Sorin Markov....  
  
and are planning to make another version of him in Dark Ascension. Please. God. Dear Lords of the Multiverse. Do. Not. Print. Sorin2. in foil.   
  
I will not forgive you if you do. Because you have 2 printings of Markov out there already, a third printing of Sorin (in a new form) in foil would be just too much.  
  
It's not because he's a Planeswalker, or a Mythic Rare, or the posterboy of the set that concerns me. Money is usually not that bad an issue for Planeswalkers.   
  
It is because  
  
  
**V A M P I R E S**!  
  
D O! N O T!  
  
***S P A R K L E***!

Posted By: Tellion12 (8/2/2011 11:55:25 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Maybe not the most usable planeswalker in competitive play,   
but his Ultimate ability is incredibly fun in casual.  
  
EDIT- And now, meet the new Sorin from Dark Ascension, clearly tweaked for faster formats:  
  
Sorin, Lord of Innistrad  
Planeswalker - Sorin (3 base loyalty)  
2WB  
  
+1 - Put a 1/1 black Vampire token with Lifelink onto the battlefield  
-2 - You get an emblem with "Creatures you control get +1/+0"  
-6 - Destroy up to three target creatures and/or other Planeswalkers. Return each card put into a graveyard this way to the battlefield under your control.  
  
Interesting. His first two abilities seem \*quite\* useful.  
Again, his Ultimate seems mostly for fun, but I could certainly see it creating some great stories.  
All in all a total upgrade for Mr. Markov, IMO... too bad he's \*already\* going for $55 :-P  
  
It's also cool to see another enemy-colors Planeswalker.  
Hopefully we'll get an Izzet Planeswealker eventually- maybe even Niv-Mizzet himself?

posts.post_content:
Does anyone not see the obvious Mana curve Wizards is pointing at you?  
  
Turn 5: [Monomania](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Monomania) to rid your opponent of anything that will stop you.  
Turn 6: [Sorin Markov](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sorin Markov), use his -3  
Turn 7: [Sorin's Vengeance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sorin's Vengeance)  
  
Vampire decks just got janky.

Posted By: Deco_y (7/7/2011 9:40:31 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Currently the lowest rated planeswalker? Impossible.  
He's not banned in Commanders yet. Consider his second effect when everyone starts with 40 life instead of 20.   
Maybe it's because his ultimate is not up to snuff, but really, could you ask for something else?  
I had an argument as to why Sorin is terrible, obviously i defended him.   
  
My last argument was, "Well... i guess in a couple of turns i could control you. Now you like him! I win!"  
Then i got slapped.  
  
Well deserved...  
FYI this was posted in the middle of August, just in case he DOES get banned :(

Posted By: drpvfx (1/11/2012 11:36:21 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@jimmy  
  
I highly doubt that was legal for three reasons:  
1) if by secede you meant concede, you're not allowed to do that. Check the rulings.  
2) if that player didnt have anything that allowed him to sac his creatures, you couldnt do it. You vcant just say ''i'm saccing this creature for the hell of it.''  
3) unless he had a hand modifier or cards that allowed him to discard at will, you couldnt have made him discard his entire hand for the same reason you cant sac a creature to nothing.  
  
frankly, I'm astounded the defending player let you do that. I find it tricky to believe that both of you were that clueless about the rules, and didnt think to call over someone who knows them.
posts.html:
@jimmy

I highly doubt that was legal for three reasons:
1) if by secede you meant concede, you're not allowed to do that. Check the rulings.
2) if that player didnt have anything that allowed him to sac his creatures, you couldnt do it. You vcant just say ''i'm saccing this creature for the hell of it.''
3) unless he had a hand modifier or cards that allowed him to discard at will, you couldnt have made him discard his entire hand for the same reason you cant sac a creature to nothing.

frankly, I'm astounded the defending player let you do that. I find it tricky to believe that both of you were that clueless about the rules, and didnt think to call over someone who knows them.

posts.post_content:
The art seems brighter than the Zendikar one...  
EDIT: 1. Quit downrating me, it actually is a lot brighter, and 2. I had to sell all of mine because my EDH playgroup DID ban them. Have to settle for my [Sharuum](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sharuum) deck now...  
EDIT: This was a wonderful change actually. It's a lot more fun than just "Tutor Sorin, [Hidetsugu's Second Rite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hidetsugu's Second Rite), good game, let the real men finish this." I like this, and Sorin is really unhealthy for EDH.
